<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 12"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Thaumaturge's Demesne](/Feats.aspx?ID=3723) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Abjuration" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=2" />
<trait label="Arcane" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=11" />
<trait label="Thaumaturge" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=432" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Dark Archive](/Sources.aspx?ID=129) pg. 46</row>

</column>

---

You have claimed an area or location as your demesne, granting you the ability to ward and protect it. When you select this feat, choose a demesne, an area of no more than 2,000 square feet. You must legitimately own the area or, if its a public area, you must lay claim to the area without anyone contesting it.

 Once you've chosen your demesne, it's automatically protected by an arcane [_private sanctum_](/Spells.aspx?ID=235) spell with an unlimited duration, heightened to half your level rounded up and using your thaumaturge class DC in place of a spell DC, if necessary. Additionally, the demesne is attended by three unseen custodians, as a successful [_unseen custodians_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=39) ritual, and one object in the area gains an elemental sentinel, as a successful [_elemental sentinel_](/Rituals.aspx?ID=57) ritual.

<title level="2">Thaumaturge's Demesne leads to...</title>
[Unlimited Demesne](/Feats.aspx?ID=3734)
name: Thaumaturge's Demesne
